Package ohos.agp.components

Class DatePicker

  • java.lang.Object
    • ohos.agp.components.Component
      • ohos.agp.components.ComponentContainer
        • ohos.agp.components.StackLayout
          • ohos.agp.components.DatePicker
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ComponentParent

    public class DatePicker
extends StackLayout
    Provides a date picker for selecting a date.

    This method allows users to select a date using the year, month, and day columns. If only the year or month are required, or if the sequence of year, month, and day needs to the customized, use DateOrder.

    Since:
    1

      Defines the display format of DatePicker components.

      Provides a date changed listener.

    • Method Detail

      • getYear

        public int getYear​()
        Obtains the year set in the date picker.

        This method displays year in the form of digits, for example, 2019.

        Returns:
        Returns the year set in the date picker, for example, 2019.
        Since:
        1

      • getMonth

        public int getMonth​()
        Obtains the month set in the date picker.

        This method displays month in the form of digits, for example, 5, which indicates May.

        Returns:
        Returns the month set in the date picker, for example, 6.
        Since:
        1

      • getDayOfMonth

        public int getDayOfMonth​()
        Obtains the day set in the date picker.

        This method displays day in the form of digits, for example, 25, which indicates the 25th day in a month.

        Returns:
        Returns the day set in the date picker, for example, 25.
        Since:
        1

      • getMaxDate

        public long getMaxDate​()
        Obtains the maximal date supported by the date picker.

        The maximal date is displayed in digits, in unit of seconds elapsed since the Unix epoch. The default maximal date is the seconds corresponding to 2038-01-19 03:14:07.

        Returns:
        Returns the maximal date supported by the date picker.
        Since:
        1

      • getMinDate

        public long getMinDate​()
        Obtains the minimal date supported by the date picker.

        The minimal date is displayed in digits, in unit of seconds elapsed since the Unix epoch. The default minimal date is the seconds corresponding to 2007-11-05 00:00:00.

        Returns:
        Returns the minimal date supported by the date picker.
        Since:
        1

      • setMaxDate

        public void setMaxDate​(long maxDate)
        Sets the maximal date supported by the date picker.
        Parameters:
        maxDate - Indicates the maximal date supported by the date picker, in unit of seconds elapsed since the Unix epoch.
        Since:
        1

      • setMinDate

        public void setMinDate​(long minDate)
        Sets the minimal date supported by the date picker.
        Parameters:
        minDate - Indicates the minimal date supported by the date picker, in unit of seconds elapsed since the Unix epoch.
        Since:
        1

      • updateDate

        public void updateDate​(int year,
                       int month,
                       int dayOfMonth)
        Updates the current date.

        This method updates the year, month, and day in the date picker.

        Parameters:
        year - Indicates the year, which cannot be less than 0.
        month - Indicates the month, which ranges from 1 to 12.
        dayOfMonth - Indicates the day of the month. The value cannot be less than 1. If the value is greater than the maximum day of a month, the maximum day is used.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - Throws this exception if year is less than 0, month is less than 1, or dayOfMonth is less than 1.
        Since:
        1

      • setValueChangedListener

        public void setValueChangedListener​(DatePicker.ValueChangedListener valueChangedListener)
        Sets a date change listener.

        This method sets the ValueChangedListener to monitor date change events. These events can be proceed by calling the ValueChangedListener#onValueChanged method. The listener notifies the application of change events of a date picker.

        Parameters:
        valueChangedListener - Indicates the date change listener, which is used to process date change events.
        Since:
        4

      • getValueChangedListener

        public DatePicker.ValueChangedListener getValueChangedListener​()
        Obtains the listener set by setValueChangedListener for monitoring data updates.
        Returns:
        Returns the listener.
        Since:
        4

      • setDateOrder

        public void setDateOrder​(int dateOrder)
        Sets the date format.

        Multiple styles are supported, for example, year-month-day and month-day-year. For details about the supported date formats, see DateOrder.

        Parameters:
        dateOrder - Indicates the date format. For details about parameter value range, see DateOrder.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - Throws this exception if the DateOrder interface doesn't contain this value.
        Since:
        1

      • getDateOrder

        public int getDateOrder​()
        Obtains the date format.

        This method obtains the display format of date, for example, year-month-day and month-day-year. For details about the supported date formats, see DateOrder.

        Returns:
        Returns the display format of date. For details about the parameter value range, see DateOrder.
        Since:
        1

      • init

        public void init​(int year,
                 int monthOfYear,
                 int dayOfMonth,
                 DatePicker.ValueChangedListener valueChangedListener)
        Initializes the date picker.

        This method initializes the date picker, including updating the year, month, and day, and setting the date change listener.

        Parameters:
        year - Indicates the initial year.
        monthOfYear - Indicates the initial month, which ranges from 1 to 12.
        dayOfMonth - Indicates the day in the month.
        valueChangedListener - Indicates the date change listener, which can be null.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - Throws this exception if year is less than 0, month is less than 1, or dayOfMonth is less than 1.
        Since:
        4

      • setYearFixed

        public void setYearFixed​(boolean fixed)
        Sets whether to disable the year selector.

        This method can set the year selector to a fixed state to disable it.

        Parameters:
        fixed - Indicates the year selector state. true means to disable the year selector; false means to enable the year selector.
        Since:
        1

        public boolean isYearFixed​()

        Returns:

      • getSelectedTextBackgroundElement

      • setSelectedNormalTextMarginRatio

        public void setSelectedNormalTextMarginRatio​(float textMarginRatio)
        Sets the ratio of the selected to normal text margin in this date picker.
        Parameters:
        textMarginRatio - Indicates the ratio to set. The value must be greater than or equal to 0.0f. The default value is 1.0f.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - Throws this exception if the parameter value is less than 0.0f.
        Since:
        3
        See Also:
        getSelectedNormalTextMarginRatio()

      • getSelectedNormalTextMarginRatio

        public float getSelectedNormalTextMarginRatio​()
        Obtains the ratio of the selected to normal text margin in this date picker.
        Returns:
        Returns the ratio.
        Since:
        3
        See Also:
        setSelectedNormalTextMarginRatio(float)

      • setDisplayedLinesElements

        public void setDisplayedLinesElements​(Element top,
                                      Element bottom)
        Sets a Element instance used to draw a split line for the selected text in a date picker.
        Parameters:

        bottom - Indicates the Element instance used to draw a split line at the bottom of the selected text.

      • setWheelModeEnabled

        public void setWheelModeEnabled​(boolean isEnabled)
        Sets whether to enable the wheel mode of a date picker to allow the maximum value on the selector to wrap around the minimum value.
        Parameters:
        isEnabled - Specifies whether to enable the wheel mode; true indicates to enable the wheel mode; false indicates to disable the wheel mode.
        Since:
        4

      • isWheelModeEnabled

        public boolean isWheelModeEnabled​()
        Obtains whether to enable the wheel mode of a date picker to allow the maximum value on the selector to wrap around the minimum value.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the wheel mode is enabled; returns false otherwise.
        Since:
        4

      • setSelectorItemNum

        public void setSelectorItemNum​(int itemNum)
        Sets the number of items to display on a selector.
        Parameters:
        itemNum - Indicates the number of all items to display on the selector.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - Throws this exception if the number of items to display on the selector is less than or equal to 0.
        Since:
        4

      • getSelectorItemNum

        public int getSelectorItemNum​()
        Obtains the number of all items in a selector.
        Returns:
        Returns the number of all items in the selector. The default value is 0.
        Since:
        4
